abstract: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints announces it will maintain its close association with Boy Scouts despite its objections over youth organization's decision to allow openly gay people to serve as leaders; Mormon Church is single largest sponsor of Boy Scouts, and disagreement over gay leaders had fueled speculation that it would sever its ties to group.
lead_paragraph: The church ended speculation that it would sever ties with the Boy Scouts of America because of the Scouts’ decision to let openly gay adults serve as leaders.

headline.main: Mormon Church Will Keep Ties With Boy Scouts Despite Objecting to Gay Leaders
headline.print_headline: Mormon Church Will Keep Ties With Boy Scouts Despite Objecting to Gay Leaders

snippet: The church ended speculation that it would sever ties with the Boy Scouts of America because of the Scouts’ decision to let openly gay adults serve as leaders.
